availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert G. Marks (Grant County, Kentucky, school teacher and soldier (11th KY Cav))

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, school teacher and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Joanna Sipple Marks in Gallatin County, Kentucky, in November 1847. Father of Meriam Marks and William Marks. School teacher in Grant County in 1850. School teacher in Grant County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and a corporal from September 22, 1862 to March 7, 1863. Discharged on account of disability on March 7, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 354A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 821.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Downingsville, p. 532B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0109.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Gallatin County Marriages, Film 000509036, p. 200.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 278-9.
